it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5951907.server

Class MyHTTPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5951907.server.MyHTTPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HTTPServer

    public class MyHTTPServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements HTTPServer
    Simple implementation of the interface HTTPServer. Serves one request at time, sequentially accepting connections and serving them.
    Author:
    Simone Cipriani, 5951907

      • MyHTTPServer

        public MyHTTPServer(int port,
                    int backlog,
                    java.net.InetAddress address)
        Instantiate an object of this class by storing information needed for binding the associated ServerSocket. N.B. the socket is not bind until the method start() is called.
        Parameters:
        port - to instantiate ServerSocket listen
        backlog - to instantiate ServerSocket
        address - to instantiate ServerSocket

        private java.net.Socket accept()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Listen for incoming connections on the opened ServerSocket.
        Returns:
        a Socket client to be served
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong with connection

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(HTTPHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: HTTPServer
        Adds a new handler in the server. Each server has a list of HTTPHandler. A request is handled by the first handler that is able to handle it.
        Specified by:
        addHandler in interface HTTPServer
        Parameters:
        handler - an HTTPHandler.

      • enableLogging

        public void enableLogging(boolean enable,
                          java.io.FileOutputStream f)
        Enable log prints about server activities.
        Parameters:
        enable - self-explanatory
        f - the OutputStream in which to print the logs (if null, System.out will be used)
